title: Labor in power
creator_credit: Sue Spencer and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
brief_description: In a decade of profound change, from 1983 to 1993, the ABC Television News and Current Affairs Political Documentary Unit compiled a unique series, capturing the key elements of the Australian Labour Party’s ten-year rule. The battle between Bob Hawke and Paul Keating for the Labor Party leadership was one of the most divisive in Australian political history the seeds of which can be traced back as far as 1980. The series is an intensely personal examination of the Hawke-Keating relationship, and through more than 120 interviews with Cabinet Ministers, senior bureaucrats and staff advisers, the series offers an insider’s view of who wields power in Australia, and how. The five episodes are; “Taking power”, “Taxing times”, “Conserving power”, “The recession we had to have” and “The sweetest victory”.
